text: A fox, whose tail had been cut by a strain, was so ashamed that she considered her life horrifying and humiliating, so she decided that the solution would be to advise the other sisters to cut their tails too, so as to conceal with general equality their personal defect. He then gathered all his companions together, telling them that the tail was not only an ugly addition, but also a burden without reason. And one of them answered and said, Behold, sister, if it were not for thy own good, wouldst thou give us this counsel? Beware of those who give advice for their own gain, not for the sake of doing good.
title: La zorra con el rabo cortado
author: nan Esopo
